text: thumb|Newton's own copy of the first edition. He wrote on it the changes he wanted to make for the second edition The Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica (English: Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy) is a trilogy, written by Isaac Newton and published on 5 July 1687. The three-book work describes physics and mathematics. It states Newton's laws of motion and the derivation of Kepler's Laws, and observations on gravity. Category:17th- century books Category:Mathematics books Category:Physics Category:1680s works
title: Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica
